name: donsoze
text: Is this how Corneilius got his job at The Spice Channel?

name: epicurus
text: If I were a SF and I saw this in the paper, I'd write him.

name: phthoggos
text: somehow I don't think you are what he is looking for.

name: draykid
text: Considering this strip's history with homosexual relations, are you really willing to make that assumption?

name: i_love_kate
text: What the hell is this strip's "history with homosexual relations?"

name: catachresis
text:
I love how since the deceptions of Philippe, there are still strips about how Lie Bot tells people things, and they believe them.
He is called Lie Bot.

name: laserblade
text: But maybe this time he's changed!

name: daaaaang
text: also mention something about Uncle Culpepper

name: fugazirancid
text: I want to start a band and call it The Deceptions of Phillipe.

name: anzio
text: He's just so damn confident when he tells you these things! And who could say no to those sideburns?

name: wehavemagnums
text: One of Lie Bot's best lies IMHO.

name: mrmark
text: lie bot manages to find the perfect lie based on character. for philippe it is usually something dark and awful (which phillipe seems to gravitate towards) and for corneleus a nearly irresistable opportunity to be gentlemanly old-school. brilliant.

name: saint
text: lie bot has surpassed Satan as the father of lies. he is now the Devil's uncle.

name: thesyndicate88
text: The grand-uncle of lies doesn't really have a good ring to it, though.

name: epicurus
text: Don't be too hasty...

name: baryonyx
text: Or at least, that is what he tells people. And they believe him.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Oh hell and damn. We knew this day was coming ever since Big Blue beat Garry Kasparov.

name: bobo
text: I love how Cornelius' ad is pretty nasty without Lie Bot's help, "Shall we bounce together, in the rumble seat . . ." He did do porno captions though.

name: snoozebar
text:
It's not as nasty as you think - the rumble seat is a real thing in old timey cars.

Wikipedia source , I choose you!

name: tellumo
text: It's super effective!

name: phthoggos
text: "Prior to World War I, a single, center-mounted rumble seat was sometimes referred to as a mother-in-law seat."

name: mattfish
text: Put the old bitch in the back, and roll up the windows

name: chaesar
text:
I wanna hear more about the NASTY divorced person.

"She didn't like me...now I am NASTY..."

name: cdtm
text: I can see Phillip going off the deep end like this on his first rejection.  O_o

name: dissembly
text:
Yes, but he thinks it means he no longer places his dishes neatly on the sink immediatey after eating. That is nasty.

(Later, of course, he will be unable to sleep, picturing the dishes still on the coffee table, Lyle going to clean them up and slipping on something in the process, Phillipe screams NOOO!)

name: professoryes
text:
I get the bizarre feeling that the last thing the divorced guy wants is to get "personal" with someone.

But hey: Ring the MILF-Man and see what cooks.

name: i_love_kate
text: ANYTHING AT ALL

name: tekende
text: I have always found the NASTY person funny, but now, for some reason, sitting here alone in my parents' house at night, I'm a little frightened.

name: hellofyellin
text:
Why does anybody trust Liebot?

His name is Liebot.

name: afronaut
text: It is rude not to trust a robot.

name: quazifuji
text: Never trust a robot

name: charchar
text: Do Lie Bot's lies violate the [url= http://www.anu.edu.au/people/Roger.Clarke/SOS/Asimov.html#Laws1940]rules[/url]?

name: charchar
text: The robots know I'm onto them.

name: pwb
text: the very first strip I read, and still one of my favorites

name: riazm
text:
I imagine LB to be the only robot with like, a really old, expressionless speech synthesizer. In fact he probably retrofitted it, just to help with telling lies.

Also, behind the sunglasses, HE HAS NO EYES.

name: mystkmanat
text:
And yet he has an ass.

Truly he was constructed with the sole purpose of screwing with people.

name: mockereo
text: in my opinion asses don't facilitate the screwing of people, rather being screwed by people. as in buttsex. Thoughts?

name: pa_ass_nts
text: One imagines there could be a pretty funny arc based around Mr Bear's respondents.

name: overman
text: Old-style is my favorite beer.  Go cubs.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

-Ray-
Oh yeah!

-Roast Beef-
DAMMIT

-Pat-
Free music on the Internet.

-Philippe-
I slept in today!

-Mr. Bear-
The 1845

-Lyle-
mango margaritas

-Molly-
A "talk," if you can call it that

-Onstad-
Feeling kind of faint
Losing a shadow

-Nice Pete-
<No Title>
<No Title>

name: riazm
text: I totally forgot that Risotto Offensive blog story line. It was charming to read.

name: envika
text: I noticed that Mr. Bear listed himself as "SM" and not "SWM" or "SBM" or whatever.

name: arbys
text: Single Bear Male?

name: farqussus
text: Come on Connie. His name is Lie-bot. Philippe is five, but come on.

name: biznart
text: I don't recall whether Connie landed the Spice gig before or after (and I'm too lazy to look it up), but I like to think one of his first flicks was MILFy Brown, Got MILF, or some other such title.  Then, as the movie begins, he makes the connection between the subject matter and the respondents from his personal ad.

name: srikamaraja
text: Favorite - "She didn't like me - now I am NASTY"
